items.title: Full Stack Developer at Much Better Adventures (London, UK)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=10, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=9, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time

Job description

About us

Much Better Adventures is fast becoming the leading marketplace for one of the fastest growing sectors in travel - adventure. We're on a mission to inspire people to live a more adventure-rich life, help a global community of local and independent businesses to make a great living doing what they love, and protect the planet’s most inspiring natural landscapes in the process.

We were voted the UK’s ‘Best for Experiences’ in 2016, are continually rated 5* by our tribe of loyal customers, and are founded by the UK's 'Young Travel Entrepreneurs of the Year' 2017.

We’re backed by some of Europe’s leading investors and entrepreneurs, and are partly-community owned. Now we're building a team of super talented, passionate and ambitious people to join us.


The role

We are looking for exceptional and ambitious developers who enjoy working on all aspects of web development with a leaning towards the infrastructure and architectural aspects of the job. For the right candidate there will be opportunities to carve out a leading role in the infrastructure side of the business as the team grows. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.

You will be keen to learn and leverage new technologies best suited to the task at hand. Our stack is broad and wide ranging: https://stackshare.io/much-better-adventures/much-better-adventure.

You will be joining a small, cross-functional product team and be expected to dig in to all facets of the products' development.

As a full-stack developer in the Much Better Adventures product team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in Python/Django, JavaScript/React, and PostgreSQL.



Benefits


If you want to disrupt one of the fastest growing sectors of travel, get a kick out of supporting local and independent businesses around the world, and are in your element on skis, a bike, a surfboard or something equally exciting, you are in the right place.

  • Competitive salary with share options
  • An entrepreneurial environment where great ideas are actively encouraged, and taking responsibility for them is expected
  • Flexible working arrangements - work where/when you want
  • 25 days paid holiday a year, plus 5 extra days to experience a Much Better Adventure or two each year.
  • Monthly company meet-ups in a variety of inspiring and adventurous settings
  • Budget and time for continued learning and self development, including courses, monthly audible/books budget, and access to training, classes and talks from Europe's leading entrepreneurs and mentors
  • Budget for home-working set up, your choice of laptop etc
  • Pension scheme (UK-based employees)
  • The warm fuzzy feeling that comes with knowing you are making a huge difference to small independent business, local economies and communities. Did we mention our Foundation?

Application process

We'll do short video calls to get to know each other a bit better, and in-person or longer video interviews with the top candidates after that.

About Much Better Adventures

The way we travel is changing. This is the work-hard, play-harder generation. We are time-poor, experience-hungry, and usually have a nightmare trying to organise our next trip...

So we're here to sort it out.

Much Better Adventures is fast becoming the leading marketplace for one of the fastest growing sectors in travel - adventure. We're on a mission to inspire people to live a more adventure-rich life, help a global community of local and independent businesses to make a great living doing what they love, and protect the planet’s most inspiring natural landscapes in the process.

We were voted the UK’s ‘Best for Experiences’ in 2016, are continually rated 5* by our tribe of loyal customers, and are founded by the UK's 'Young Travel Entrepreneurs of the Year' 2017.

We’re backed by some of Europe’s leading investors and entrepreneurs, and are partly-community owned. Now we're building a team of super talented, passionate and ambitious people to join us.

If you want to build a global travel-tech business in one of the fastest growing sectors of travel, get a kick out of supporting local and independent businesses around the world, and are in your element on skis, a bike, a surfboard or something equally exciting, you are in the right place.

----

You can see our current openings below.

Nothing there quite you? Fear not. We always like to hear from awesome people in the tech, marketing, sales, travel and creative worlds, so feel free to contact us anytime if your perfect role isn’t listed above just now.

No agents please (unless you’re looking for a career change) ;)

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=19, nodejs=28, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=10, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=15}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Collaboration Tools, Computer Software, Design
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private

Job description

InVision is the Digital Product Design platform used to make the world’s best customer experiences. We provide design tools and educational resources for teams to navigate  every stage of the product design process, from ideation to development.   

Today, more than 3.5 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. That includes more than 80 percent of the Fortune 100, and organizations like Airbnb, Amazon, HBO, Netflix, Slack, Starbucks and Uber, who are now able to design better products, faster.

InVision is a fully distributed company with employees in 25 countries around the world. The company has raised more than $235 million in funding from leading investors including Accel, ICONIQ, FirstMark, Tiger Global, Battery Ventures, and Spark Capital. Visit us at InVisionApp.com andInVisionApp.com/blog.

You will contribute to an environment that enables you to do your best engineering work, and you’ll do it with new web standards and frameworks like ES6, React, MongoDB, Node.js, Go, and Docker. We empower engineers by being laser focused on maximum developer velocity through automation of tests, builds, deploys and tight customer feedback loop to continuously improve the product.

Building and shipping something this amazing and owning it from prototypes and specifications to release requires constant collaboration with the brightest people in the organization. Whether you’re at a beach house in Hawaii or a coffee shop on the East Coast, you’ll have the support of brilliant developers at your fingertips to get you through and keep the workday challenging and fun.

About the Team:

You’ll be working on one of the most difficult and yet most crucial projects for InVision’s future, helping to deliver a seamless and delightful experience to our Customers as we forge ahead into new territory.

Responsibilities:

  • You're part of a small team that operates like a mini-startup - you’ll transition between front-end styling to client-side and server-side logic, write unit and functional tests, and verify before deploying
  • You will be responsible for building and shipping all components necessary for your product, and you will work with Product Managers and Designers to determine the functionality, look, and feel
  • You’ll build small, robust backend API services in GoLang that need to perform under load and deliver data pulled from large datasets
  • You will frequently interface with other Product Engineering teams and Platform Service teams to take advantage of and incorporate their services and tools into your product
  • Every day offers a variety of work, an opportunity to contribute new ideas, and the ability to share your knowledge through blog posts and presentations

Requirements:

  • 8+ years of full stack experience designing and building high volume, scalable SaaS applications from end-to-end
  • Strong proficiency preferably in either Node.js, or Golang or solid professional experience in one of the following backend languages: Java, Ruby, Python
  • 5+ years of strong experience debugging complex issues at every level of the stack; can debug a web application problem single-handedly all the way from the browser, through the transport, through the application and servers and databases and asynchronous queues. Not afraid of logs and core dumps
  • Use of continuous integration and delivery technologies at an expert level and ability to teach others best practices.
  • Curiosity to iterate and improve on solutions; you view unknowns as challenges and enjoy them
  • Motivation to understand the business and our users, their requirements, and deliver results
  • Passion for continued learning and achieving personal goals through developer community involvement and contributions
  • 2+ years of experience mentoring and leading less experiences engineers

Benefits

Premium Medical, Dental, Vision
Flexible time off policy
Remote, work from home
Gym memebership
unlimited Starbucks
unlimited Amazon books

QR Code Link to This Post




  

OveractDev Technology Partners is looking for a few very special software 
engineers.
 We build software applications for Fortune 500 companies (like Amazon, 
Intuit, GoDaddy) and innovative, funded startups (like Lytro and Reputation 
Defender). We are not a software product company, we are a high-end engineering 
firm. Our clients count on us to solve tough problems, crack new technologies, 
and complete complex projects on time. We are judged by the quality of our work 
and our knowledge of best practices.




Let us know if this sounds interesting to you:

 * This is a job where you work from home and set your own hours. 
 * This is an opportunity to be paid exactly what you are worth - measured by 
the productive value of your work. This is also an opportunity to dramatically 
increase your productive value and income. 
 * This is a job with full benefits. 
 * This is a job with a high "Freedom Multiplier". You work while in control 
of where you do it, when you do it, and with whom you do it. 
 * This is a career path where your "job security" is NOT based on your 
position or title. Here, it is based on you developing high "personal power" - 
measured by your skills in Leadership, Ownership, Thinknology, Mastery of 
Discipline, Teamwork, and Rapport Building. 
OveractDev is looking for Senior or higher Software Engineers specializing in 
the following:

 * Areas: full-stack Web Application Development, iOS Development, Server-side 
Development, or Front-end Development 
 * Languages: Java/Spring, Ruby On Rails, Node.js, javascript, AngularJS, 
ObjectiveC 
 * Bonus Points: cloud deployment (AWS), Dev Ops. NoSQL 
If you are up for a challenge and have at least 5-7 years of experience in one 
of these dev stacks, please submit your resume along with URLs to any of the 
following: github, LinkedIn, any published iOS apps. You won't regret it...
 
<http://overactdev.com/careers-at-overactdev/job-full-stack-software-engineer/> 
 * Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster. 
 * do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offers 
 * OK to highlight this job opening for persons with disabilities

At Low Mango we want to help everyone find a great place to live! Our staff has helped hundreds of people – now we are looking to grow our team and technology so we can be useful to lots more people.

We are seeking a talented full-stack developer with 4+ years of experience. Our organization is still small, and individual roles are deep – you are expected to contribute across the entire stack and develop through all stages of development.

# You Will

* Collaborate with our Founder and others in all phases of development from concept to launch
* Have full visibility of how your work affects front-end clients and your coworkers
* Launch the new generation of our existing tools and applications, while helping maintain existing tools we use day-to-day
* Work on both the front-end and back-end of our web applications
* Have input on tools and technical decisions
* Manipulate lots of data
* Help improve our software development process and engineering best practices as our team continues to grow

# You Should

* Have experience building production web applications
* Enjoy working with JavaScript frameworks
* Be comfortable with varied responsibilities
* Proven ability to deliver an amazing user experience
* Have experience with agile web development

# You will be using

* NodeJS, React, HTML, CSS
* HTTP APIs: Several
* Git: Repos, branching, familiarity with gitflow, rebasing, complex merging, etc
* GitHub: Code repository, issue & project management, pull requests and github integrations
* Airtable: Rapid testing and development of ideas, simple database
* Experience with NoSQL databases and some experience with Relational databases
* Google Cloud Platform: For most of our stack
* Docker and containerizing applications as well as orchestration using Kubernetes
* Elastic Search: Subset of our data for mobile-web-app
* Frontapp: Communicating with Clients & Real Estate professionals via email, SMS and other channels

Responsibilities include but are not limited to developing, releasing, monitoring and maintaining modern web applications.

All candidates will have

  • a Bachelor's or higher degree in technical field of study
  • a minimum of two years' experience developing, monitoring and troubleshooting modern web applications
  • expert level knowledge in one or more modern web development stacks such as Angular, React.js and Node.js
  • expert level knowledge of Javascript and ES6/7, HTML, CSS
  • hands-on experiencing building web applications based on MVC or MVVM
  • excellent troubleshooting and creative problem-solving abilities
  • excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills

Ideally, candidates will also have

  • experience with automated unit and integration testing and continuous integration
  • experience with modern web features such as web workers, WSS, WebRTC, native fetch and others
  • experience with React-Redux, redux-saga and react native
  • experience writing asynchronous, non-blocking code

JOB TYPE: Full time

LOCATION:
Remote
Anywhere in
New York, NY, USA

EXPERIENCE: expert

COMPANY: Creatella; 75-100 employees; 75-100% remote;

SKILLS:
• Java
• MongoDB
• Python
• Express.js
• AngularJS
• Node.js

ABOUT US
Creatella is an ambitious and enthusiastic Venture Builder, empowering visionary entrepreneurs to build the best startups in FinTech, EdTech, HealthTech etc, around the globe. Born in Singapore, with European and Japanese roots and a highly diverse team spanning 20 countries, we aim to become the largest tech startups builder in the bustling South East Asia.

One of those startups, Waft, is revolutionizing and disrupting the world of fragrance, letting you create your own fragrances. Creatella accompanies Waft in its expansion and we are look for a Senior Lead Developer with great knowledge and technical abilities. You will be based in Waft, New York City, USA.

Interested in joining a thrilling ecommerce startup and contribute to its global growth?

WHAT YOU’LL DO
■ Build the front end of new projects, making them beautiful, intuitive, and delightful
■ Manage required troubleshooting operational issues
■ Work with stakeholders during the requirement gathering and acceptance testing process
■ Collaborate well with the team to design and create advanced, elegant and efficient systems
■ Interpret code architecture solutions to support a high-performance and reputable product
■ Take your skills to the next level by working with the latest tech on cutting edge projects
■ Work closely with our team, learning from professionals
■ Work closely with Waft’s CEO, a successful serial entrepreneur and develop your skills with a diverse, international company.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU
■ Empowerment: We trust our talented team. Whatever your ambitions or ideas, we encourage you to go after them and will support you.
■ Growth: Learn from the CEO and grow your skills and experiences further in the social media
■ Challenges: Wrap yourself around the entire customer life cycle and blend the art of engagement, the science of data, and the power of technology to create digital ecosystems that connects at every touch point.
■ An opportunity to change the world: To be a part of accomplishing things never accomplished before on the internet - to disrupt the fragrance industry.

YOUR SKILLS
■ Solid skill set in MongoDB, Express, Angular, Node and MongoDB
■ Highly knowledgeable with Java and Python is a bonus!
■ Mastery of the basics: JavaScript, ES6/ES7, HTML5, CSS3
■ Experience on a remote team a plus
■ Fairly good command of English (both written and spoken)


PERSONAL QUALITIES (as important as skills!)
■ Entrepreneurial: You might be already be a founder or have that startup spirit - you certainly don’t want to just be an employee.
■ Creative: You think outside the box to relentlessly find innovative solutions
■ Challenger: You like to push yourself and go beyond your own goals. We’re ambitious and we want you to be too!
■ Quality-driven: You create great work you’re proud of!
■ Team player: You share ideas, convey the vision, empower your team

OTHERS
■Work comfortably from home, remotely, at flexible hours

Creatella accompanies Waft in its expansion and we are look for a Mean Stack Developers with great knowledge and technical abilities. You will be based in Waft, New York City, USA.

Interested in joining a thrilling ecommerce startup and contribute to its global growth?

WHAT YOU’LL DO
■ Build the front end of new projects, making them beautiful, intuitive, and delightful
■ Collaborate well with the team to design and create advanced, elegant and efficient systems
■ Interpret code architecture solutions to support a high-performance and reputable product
■ Take your skills to the next level by working with the latest tech on cutting edge projects
■ Work closely with our team, learning from professionals
■ Work closely with Waft’s CEO, a successful serial entrepreneur and develop your skills with a diverse, international company.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU
■ Empowerment: We trust our talented team. Whatever your ambitions or ideas, we encourage you to go after them and will support you.
■ Growth: Learn from the CEO and grow your skills and experiences further in the social media
■ Challenges: Wrap yourself around the entire customer life cycle and blend the art of engagement, the science of data, and the power of technology to create digital ecosystems that connects at every touch point.
■ An opportunity to change the world: To be a part of accomplishing things never accomplished before on the internet - to disrupt the fragrance industry.

YOUR SKILLS
■ Solid skill set in Express, Angular, Node and MongoDB
■ Familiar with Java and Python is a bonus!
■ Mastery of the basics: JavaScript, ES6/ES7, HTML5, CSS3
■ Experience on a remote team a plus
■ Fairly good command of English (both written and spoken)


PERSONAL QUALITIES (as important as skills!)
■ Entrepreneurial: You might be already be a founder or have that startup spirit - you certainly don’t want to just be an employee.
■ Creative: You think outside the box to relentlessly find innovative solutions
■ Challenger: You like to push yourself and go beyond your own goals. We’re ambitious and we want you to be too!
■ Quality-driven: You create great work you’re proud of!
■ Team player: You share ideas, convey the vision, empower your team

OTHERS
■Work comfortably from home, remotely, at flexible hours

items.title: Senior JavaScript Developer at Float (New York, NY)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=23, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=31}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time

Job description

We're seeking a Senior JavaScript Developer who is excited at the prospect of working with a small, highly-skilled engineering team to scale a fast-growing SaaS product.

You will help us develop new features and maintain our codebase while supporting a wide variety of technologies. You should be proficient with front-end and JavaScript development in a modern microservice environment and familiar with the associated benefits and challenges in creating stable, performant, rapidly deployable services.

This is a 100% remote, full-time position. You’ll report directly to our CTO, who is based in New York.


About You

  • You are passionate about developing applications that communicate through elegantly designed, well-defined systems that meet defined business goals.
  • You're a great communicator, naturally curious and comfortable diving in and helping out without ego.
  • You'll have strong experience in a collaborative environment working with web applications, preferably B2B SaaS apps.


You should consider yourself an expert in:

  • JavaScript - React.js + Redux development
  • Modern ECMAScript Standards
  • HTML5 and CSS
  • Front-end build and test tools (npm, yarn, webpack, babel, jest, puppeteer)
  • Source control workflow, Git/GitFlow
  • Client/browser performance issues (rendering, fetching, profiling, etc.)

Bonus Points:

  • React Native / native iOS development
  • HTML5 Canvas
  • Node.js, PHP, SQL or MongoDB proficiency
  • GraphQL
  • Apollo
  • API management, tools and documentation
  • Good knowledge of containers (Docker), microservice architecture and functional and load automated testing.

Benefits


Benefits include:

  • Flexible work hours,
  • Work where you want,
  • Annual team meetup,
  • Medical, Dental & Vision,
  • Team Equity Pool

About Us

We're the leading resource scheduling application for agencies, studios and firms. Since 2012, we've been helping teams in more than 150 countries keep track of who’s working on what and when including NASA, Vice, Buzzfeed and RGA.

We’re profitable and 100% funded by our customers. Our team of twelve includes members in New York, Dallas, Cleveland, Australia, Portugal and Ukraine. We encourage people of different backgrounds, perspectives and locations to enhance our team and deliver their best work.

www.float.com
